p.d: Spring 1979. Denain's steelworkers have had enough. Alma, an intern in Maître Marc Duparcq's office, wants to help the unions. She meets Rodolphe, who's set up a pirate radio station supporting the movement, and Fadi, a Moroccan photographer and steelworker who has photographed a policeman shooting at a demonstrator. Alma takes them to Chambries to develop the photo in the print-works now managed by Solana. For the anniversary of their fathers' deaths, Solana and Alma patiently await the return of Caroline, who left for North Africa a year ago. Directed by: Gabriel Aghion (season 2, France, 2017) Screenplay: Dan Franck, Stéphane Osmont Cast: Alma Jodorowsky (Solana), Lilly-Fleur Pointeaux (Caroline), Stéphane Caillard (Alma), Sabine Haudepin (Micheline), Corentin Fila (Fadi), Claire Nebout (Valérie), Jérôme Anger (Vilson), Vladimir Consigny (Rodolphe), Bruno Todeschini (Duparcq), Jean Gardeil (Didier), Jean-Claude Adelin (Roger), Jean-Yves Berteloot (Mercier), Nicolas Bridet (Vildé) Genre: comedy drama
